citation.article-title: Sulfurisphaera ohwakuensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel extremely thermophilic acidophile of the order Sulfolobales.

p.s: Sulfurisphaera (Sul.fu.ri.sphae'ra. L. n. sulfur sulfur; L. masc. n. sphaera sphere; M.L. masc. n. Sulfurisphaera sulfur sphere, sulfur-metabolizing spherical cells from sulfataric fields)
Cells are Gram-negative cocci, facultatively anaerobic.
Thin sections reveal an envelope surrounding the cell membrane.
Cells contain caldarchaeol and calditoglycerocaldarchaeol as their core lipids.
The G + C content of DNA of the type species is 32.9 mol%.
Members of the genus Sulfurisphaera form a distinct cluster on the phylogenetic tree based on the 16s rRNA gene sequences.
The organisms occur in acidic solfataric fields.
The type species is Sulfurisphaera ohwakuensis.
